Absence_InputObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Absence_InputObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Absence_InputObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Absence_Input_Data.description: Absence Input ID (Used as a Lookup ID to perform an update.  If not provided, the web service will add a new instance).
Batch ID is the unique identifier.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Position_ElementObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Position_ElementObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Position_ElementObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: The field Position Reference is required for the selected Absence Component.
Position Reference is not valid for the Absence Component Reference given.

Position is not valid for this Worker as of either the start date or end date of the Absence Input.
Worker: [worker]
Position: [position]
Start Date: [start date]
End Date: [end date]

Absence_ComponentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Absence_ComponentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Absence_ComponentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Absence_Input_Data.description: The Reference Date is used to determine the effective date to retrieve the snapshot for the absence component for the input. Reference Date is required for Time Off and Accrual.

validation.validation: End Date is invalid.  A period ending on the End Date is not found for the Accrual or Time Off being processed.
validation.description: End Date is invalid.  A period ending on the End Date is not found for the Accrual or Time Off being processed.

validation.validation: Start Date is invalid.  A period beginning on the Start Date is not found for the Accrual or Time Off being processed.
validation.description: Start Date is invalid.  A period beginning on the Start Date is not found for the Accrual or Time Off being processed.

validation.validation: The Accrual or Time Off being processed does not allow adjustments or overrides.
validation.description: The Accrual or Time Off being processed does not allow adjustments or overrides.

validation.validation: Start Period must equal End Period when Adjustment is true.
validation.description: Start Period must equal End Period when Adjustment is true.

validation.validation: Reference Date must be within the Start Period for Time Off.
validation.description: Reference Date must be within the Start Period for Time Off.

validation.validation: An override is not allowed for Time Off.  Change the Adjustment flag to true.
validation.description: An override is not allowed for Time Off.  Change the Adjustment flag to true.

validation.validation: Batch ID is already associated with other types of Application Batches.
validation.description: Batch ID is already associated with other types of Application Batches.

validation.validation: End Date is required when Adjustment is true.
validation.description: End Date is required when Adjustment is true.

validation.validation: You cannot make changes to this input as it affects a completed termination adjustment.
validation.description: You cannot make changes to this input as it affects a completed termination adjustment.

validation.validation: Overrides cannot be setup for overlapping periods.  Only adjustments can be setup for overlapping periods.
validation.description: Overrides cannot be setup for overlapping periods.  Only adjustments can be setup for overlapping periods.

validation.validation: Overrides cannot be setup for overlapping periods.  Only adjustments can be setup for overlapping periods.
validation.description: Overrides cannot be setup for overlapping periods.  Only adjustments can be setup for overlapping periods.

validation.validation: End Date must be equal to or greater than the Start Date.
validation.description: End Date must be equal to or greater than the Start Date.

validation.validation: End Date is blank but later periods associated with this snapshot are ineligible for overrides. Select the [Latest End Period] period or an earlier period.
